headers.select_court_to_arbitrate: Select a court to arbitrate the case

voting.vote_successfully_committed: Your vote was successfully committed, please wait until reveal period to reveal it.
voting.jury_decided_in_favor: The jury decided in favor of:

juror_levels.level_0_description: This level is for new jurors or those frequently voting incoherently. A few coherent votes can help climb out of this level quickly.
juror_levels.level_1_description: Jurors here are gaining experience and starting to build voting reliability.
juror_levels.level_2_description: Mid-tier performance. Jurors at this level have demonstrated reasonable consistency in coherent voting.
juror_levels.level_3_description: Reliable jurors with a consistent track record of coherent votes. Just a few more coherent votes away from reaching the top.
juror_levels.level_4_description: Top-tier jurors with excellent coherence. Trusted members of the platform.
juror_levels.coherent_votes_tooltip: A Coherent Vote is a vote coherent with the final jury decision (after all the appeal instances). If the juror vote is the same as the majority of jurors it's considered a Coherent Vote.
juror_levels.score_tooltip: A score from 0 to 100 reflecting coherent voting, smoothed to prevent jurors with low vote counts from ranking too high.
juror_levels.coherent_votes_ratio_tooltip: This is the ratio of coherent votes made by a juror: the number in the left is the number of times where the juror voted coherently and the number in the right is the total number of times the juror voted. Hover to see the percentage of coherent votes.
juror_levels.total_rewards_tooltip: Users have an economic interest in serving as jurors in Kleros: collecting the Juror Rewards in exchange for their work. Each juror who is coherent with the final ruling receive the Juror Rewards composed of arbitration fees (ETH) + PNK redistribution between jurors.

alerts.kleros_different_courts: Kleros has different courts arbitrating disputes in several areas. Each court has its own purpose and policy. Take some time to choose the best court for your case. Learn more about the available courts here.
alerts.add_question_and_options: Add the question and options jurors will see when voting
alerts.hey_avoid_missing_case: Hey there! Avoid missing a case
alerts.subscribe_to_notifications: Make sure to subscribe to notifications on Settings > Notifications
alerts.dispute_last_round: This dispute is on its last round. Vote wisely, It cannot be appealed any further.
alerts.not_drawn_current_round: You were not drawn in current round.
alerts.jurors_not_drawn_yet: Jurors have not been drawn yet.

popups.dispute_created_full_message_part1: The case will be resolved by approximately

popups.submit_evidence_now: Now, it's time to submit evidence to support the case.

email_verification.invalid_link_subtitle: Oops, seems like you followed an invalid link.
email_verification.something_went_wrong_subtitle: Oops, seems like something went wrong in our systems
email_verification.congratulations_verified:
Congratulations! 
Your email has been verified!
email_verification.verification_success_subtitle: We'll remind you when your actions are required on Court, and send you notifications on key moments to help you achieve the best of Kleros.
email_verification.verification_expired_subtitle: Oops, the email verification link has expired. No worries! Go to settings and click on Resend it to receive another verification email.
email_verification.verification_email_sent_text: We sent you a verification email. Please, verify it.

case_creation.case_id_tooltip: The case ID can be found on the top left of the Case page. eg. "Case #300".
case_creation.batch_cases_tooltip: Batch Cases: You can create multiple copies of the case.
case_creation.number_of_cases_to_be_created: Number of cases to be created

evidence.no_evidence_yet: There is no evidence submitted yet

misc.past_performance_disclaimer: Note that past performance is not a guarantee of future results.
misc.fundamental_to_any_case: Fundamental to any case, the Policy provides jurors with a framework to vote fairly. It can be a set of criteria, a contract stating the rights and duties of the parties, or any set of pre-defined rules that are relevant to jurors' decision-making.
misc.you_can_attach_additional: You can attach additional information here. Important: the above description must reference the relevant parts of the file content.

mini_guides.decentralized_arbitration: The decentralized arbitration service for the disputes of the new economy.
mini_guides.what_do_i_need: What do I need to start?
mini_guides.staking_joining_court_description: To become a juror, you need to stake PNK tokens in at least one court. The more you stake, the higher your chances of being drawn to arbitrate disputes.
mini_guides.staking_jury_selection_description: When a dispute is created, jurors are randomly selected from the court, weighted by their stake. Selected jurors vote on the case during the voting period.
mini_guides.staking_juror_rewards_description: Jurors who vote coherently with the final decision receive arbitration fees in ETH and may receive PNK tokens redistributed from incoherent voters.
mini_guides.staking_subscribe_description: Enable notifications in Settings to be alerted when you're drawn for a case, when voting periods start, and other important events.
mini_guides.binary_voting_description_part1: In binary voting, jurors choose between two options or refuse to arbitrate. The option with the majority of votes wins.
mini_guides.binary_voting_juror_rewards_description: Jurors who vote with the majority receive rewards. Those who vote with the minority lose part of their staked PNK.
mini_guides.binary_voting_refuse_to_arbitrate: Jurors can choose 'Refuse to Arbitrate' if they believe the dispute is not arbitrable or violates the court policy.
mini_guides.private_voting_description: Private voting uses a commit-reveal scheme. Jurors first commit their vote secretly, then reveal it after the commit period ends.
mini_guides.private_voting_whats_different: This prevents jurors from being influenced by others' votes and ensures independent decision-making.
mini_guides.private_voting_note: Important: You must return to reveal your vote after the commit period, or it won't count.
mini_guides.ranked_voting_description: In ranked voting, jurors can rank multiple options in order of preference. This is useful for disputes with more than two possible outcomes.
mini_guides.ranked_voting_juror_rewards_description: Rewards are distributed based on how closely your ranking matches the final collective decision.
mini_guides.ranked_voting_refuse_to_arbitrate: As with binary voting, jurors can refuse to arbitrate if the dispute is not suitable for arbitration.
mini_guides.onboarding_juror_need: To be a juror, you need PNK tokens and stake them in a court.
mini_guides.onboarding_contributor_participation: As a contributor, you can participate in disputes by funding appeals or submitting evidence.
mini_guides.onboarding_case_resolution: Anyone can create a case and get it resolved by Kleros jurors.
mini_guides.resolver_start_case_description: First, you need to write a title, and a description for the case. Make it simple to read and understand.
mini_guides.resolver_parameters_list:
‚Ä¢ Choose a court to arbitrate the case.
‚Ä¢ Select a category.
‚Ä¢ Select the number of jurors.
mini_guides.resolver_parameters_cost: The more jurors you select, higher the arbitration cost will be. By default we use 3 jurors for the first round. The arbitration cost is the value used to pay the jurors for their work.
mini_guides.resolver_voting_options_description: Write the question jurors will answer when voting, and the voting options. You can have 2 or more options if needed.
mini_guides.resolver_parties_description: Define the parties involved in the dispute.
mini_guides.resolver_policy_description: Submit a Policy. The Policy provides jurors with a framework to vote fairly. It can be a set of criteria, a contract stating the rights and duties of the parties, or any set of pre-defined rules that are relevant to jurors' decision-making.
mini_guides.resolver_well_done_description: The case is ready to be created! Review the information, and submit the case. Don't forget to submit evidence, and follow up the dispute resolution process until its conclusion.

tooltips.juror_rewards_explanation: Users have an economic interest in serving as jurors in Kleros: collecting the Juror Rewards in exchange for their work. Each juror who is coherent with the final ruling receive the Juror Rewards composed of arbitration fees (ETH) + PNK redistribution between jurors.
tooltips.staking_rewards_explanation: Staking Rewards are the rewards won by staking your PNK on a court during the Kleros' Jurors incentive program.
tooltips.estimated_rewards_explanation: Estimated rewards in USD, assuming 100% coherent voting. If other jurors vote incoherently, additional rewards in the form of PNK tokens may be earned beyond this estimate.
tooltips.current_stake_sum: Current Stake (Sum of): Amount of PNK staked in this court ({{amountInCourt}}); Amount of PNK staked on its sub-courts ({{amountInSubCourts}})
tooltips.shielded_voting_tooltip: The jurors votes are hidden. Nobody can see them before the voting period completes. It takes place in a single step via Shutter Network
tooltips.shielded_voting_description: This feature hides the jurors votes until the end of the voting period.
tooltips.jurors_eligibility_description: This feature determines who can be selected as a juror.
tooltips.token_gating_tooltip: Only the jurors who possess the specified token or NFT can be selected as jurors for this case. Please input the token details below.

errors.something_went_wrong: Ooops, Something went wrong in Athens!
errors.reload_or_contact: Please reload the page or contact us if the issue is not resolved.
errors.invalid_dispute_data: The dispute data is not valid, please vote "Refuse to arbitrate"
errors.rpc_error: RPC Error: Unable to fetch dispute data. Please avoid voting.

appeal.which_option_to_fund: Which option do you want to fund?
appeal.no_losing_option_funded: No losing option has been funded in time, winner is maintained.
appeal.jury_decision_appealed: The jury decision is appealed when two options are fully funded.
appeal.appeal_paragraph_1: If after the jury has reached a decision, a party is not satisfied (because she thinks the result was unfair), she can appeal and have the dispute ruled again.
appeal.appeal_paragraph_2: Every time the case is appealed a new round starts with all the voting options available for voting again. The results of the previous rounds are irrelevant in terms of what the final result will be.
appeal.appeal_paragraph_3: Each new appeal instance will have twice the previous number of jurors plus one.
appeal.stage_1_paragraph: The jury decision is appealed when stages 1 and 2 are fully funded. In stage 1, one of the losing options must be fully funded. If no option is fully funded in time the jury decision is maintained.
appeal.stage_2_paragraph: Now, options compete together against the option fully funded at stage 1. The sum of funds must reach 100%. If it's not fully funded in time the option fully funded at stage 1 is declared the winner of the case.
appeal.crowdfunding_paragraph: Anyone can contribute to the crowdfunding of the appeal fees. Crowdfunders can win rewards in case the option they fund wins. See how much you can earn by funding appeals, at the payoff simulator.
appeal.who_wins_paragraph_1: After the final decision (when no more appeals are possible), anyone who contributed to the winning option receive the crowdfunding rewards.
appeal.who_wins_paragraph_2: In case the winning option was not funded by anyone, contributors to the other options are partially reimbursed (Amount funded minus arbitration cost to pay the jurors).
appeal.who_wins_paragraph_3: In case no one votes on the new round, 'Refuse to arbitrate' is the chosen option.
appeal.stage_one_explanation_1: Losing options can only be funded <small>before</small> the deadline.
appeal.stage_one_explanation_2: If no losing option is <small>fully funded</small> in time, the jury decision is maintained.
appeal.stage_two_explanation_1: Loser deadline has <small>finalized</small>, you can only fund the current winner.
appeal.stage_two_explanation_2: If the current winner is not fully funded in time, the option funded during the previous stage will be declared as the final winner.
appeal.stage_two_explanation_3: Following choices were funded in the stage 1: <small>{{choices}}</small>

profile.to_see_profile_connect: To see your profile, connect first
profile.court_staking_tooltip: When you are staked in a subcourt you are staked in its parent courts too. eg. Staking in the Non Technical court automatically stake in its parents: Blockchain, and General Court.

resolver.send_disputes_get_decisions: You send your disputes. Kleros sends back decisions.
resolver.to_create_dispute_connect: To create a new dispute, connect first
